Description: Round-topped limestone stela depicting Neferhotep and Sobekhotep seated before an offering-table over which a female figure pours a libation; wedjat-eyes above; three rows of Hieroglyphic text below.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1914 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 5. (pl.20)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens & Commoners of the New Kingdom
